items

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • items.Inventory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<InventorySlot>

    public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<InventorySlot>, java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the Player's inventory. It's made up of inventory slots, which contain an unlimited amount of items. When an item is added, it's put into a new slot if there is no one holding an identical one, or it is added to the slot holding these kind of items. For more info. about how items are identified, see Item.equals(Object).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Inventory

        public Inventory(int size)

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • canAdd

        public boolean canAdd(Item item)
        Checks whether the given Item can be added to the inventory. If the inventory isn't full, the item can be added. If not, the item can be added only if there is already a slot holding such items.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to check for possible addition.
        Returns:
        true if the given item can be added,
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given item is null. false if not.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String itemName)
        Checks if the inventory contains an item.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The item name to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the inventory contains at least one unit of the item with the given name, or false if not.

      • count

        public int count(java.lang.String itemName)
        Indicates how many items of the given name there are in the inventory.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The item name to be checked
        Returns:
        The amount of items of the given name stored in the inventory

      • dropAll

        public void dropAll(java.lang.String itemName)
        Removes the slot containing the item(s) with the given name.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the items to be dropped.

      • get

        public Item get(java.lang.String itemName)
        Gets the item in this inventory WITHOUT taking it (the quantity isn't decremented).
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the Item to get.
        Returns:
        The corresponding Item in this inventory, or null if there is no such item in this inventory.

      • getDataVector

        public java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> getDataVector()
        Creates a Vector with the inventory's data. This method is used to display this data, giving only relevant information (item's name and its amount).
        Returns:
        The data vector

      • put

        public boolean put(Item item)
        Puts one of the given item in the inventory.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be stored.
        Returns:
        true if the item could be added, false if not (i.e. if the inventory is full)

      • put

        public boolean put(Item item,
                   int quantity)
        Attempts to put the given Item into the inventory, indicating the amount.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be stored.
        quantity - Amount to be stored.
        Returns:
        true if the item could be added, false if not (i.e. if the inventory is full)

        Returns:

      • swap

        public Item swap(Item itemToPut,
                 java.lang.String itemToTake)
        Swaps the given Item with one of the item to take.
        Parameters:
        itemToPut - The Item to put in exchange for the one being taken.
        itemToTake - The name of the item to take in exchange for the one being put.
        Returns:
        the taken item, or null if the swap couldn't be made.

      • take

        public Item take(java.lang.String itemName)
        Takes one Item with the given name from the inventory.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the item to take.
        Returns:
        The requested item or null if there is no such item in the inventory.

      • take

        public Item take(java.lang.String itemName,
                 int quantity)
        Attempts to take quantity many items from the inventory, returning one instance of the item.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the stack from which to take.
        quantity - How many to take.
        Returns:
        An instance of the item that was taken, if successful, or null if the items couldn't be taken.
